title: Upon Going to Sleep and Waking Up
description: When the Prophet (S) went to bed at night, he would put his hand under his cheek and then say

prayerItems.content: <p style="text-align: left;"><span>When the Prophet (S) went to bed at night, he would put his hand under his cheek and then say</span></p> <p><big><span style="text-align: right;">اَلهُمّ بِسْمٍكَ أ مُؤ تٌ وَاحْيَا</span></big></p> <p style="text-align: left;"><i>Allahumma bismeka amootu wa ahiya</i></span></p> <p style="text-align: left;"><span>(O Allah, with Your Name I die and live)</span></p> <p><big><span>اَلْحَمْدُ للهِ الَّذِي أَحْيَانَا بَعْدَ مَا أَمَاتَنَا وَإِلَيْهِ النُّشُورُا</span></big></span></p> <p style="text-align: left;"><span><i>Alhamdu lil lahillathi ahyaana baada ma amatana wa ilaihin-nushoor</i></span></p> <p style="text-align: left;"><span>(All thanks and praise to Allah Who has given us life after causing us to die (i.e. sleep), and unto Him is the Resurrection). (B)</span></p>

title: Upon Completing Ablution
description: If anyone amongst you performs the ablution and upon completing it says

prayerItems.content: <p><span style="text-align: left">If anyone amongst you performs the ablution and upon completing it says</span></p> <p><big><span style="text-align: right">أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لَا إِلَهَ إلَّا اللهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيكَ لَهُ، وَأَشْهَدُ أَنَّ مُحَمَّداً عَبْدُهُ وَرَسُولُهُ</span></big></p> <p><span style="text-align: left"><i>Ashhadu ana la ilaha ilalah wah dawho la sharika lawho wa ashadu ana, Muhammadan abduwho wa rasulhwho</i></span></p> <p><span style="text-align: left">(I testify that there is no god but Allah and that Muhammad is the servant of Allah and His Messenger)</span></p> <p><span style="text-align: left">...the eight gates of Paradise will be opened for him and he may enter by whichever of them he wishes</span></p>

title: Upon Going To The Fajr Prayer
description: The Prophet (S) said upon going to Fajr salat

prayerItems.content: <p><big><span>اللَّهمَّ اجْعَلْ فَي قَلْبِي نُوْرا، ً وَفِي لِسَانِي نُوْرا، ً وَاجْعَلْ فِي سَمْعِي نُوْرا، ً وَاجْعَلْ فِي بَصَرِي نُوْرا، ً وَاجْعَلْ مِنْ خَلْفِي نُوْرا، ً وَمِنْ أَمَامِي نُوْرا، ً وَاجْعَلْ مِنْ فَوْقِي نُوْرا، ً وَمِنْ تَحْتِي نُوْرا. ً اللَّهمَّ أَعْطِنِي نُوْرا</span></big></p> <p style="text-align: left;"><i>Alahumma ijal fi qelbee nuran, we fi lisanee nuran, waj-al fi semh-e nuran, wajh al fi beseri nuran, waj al min khelfee nuran, wa min ama mee nuran, waj al min fow qee nuran, wa min tah tea nuran, Alahumma ah&#39;tea nee nura.</i></p> <p style="text-align: left;">(O Allah, place light in my heart, light in my sight, light in my hearing, light on my right hand, light on my left hand, light above me, light below me, light in front of me, light behind me, and enhance light for me). (M)</p>

<p><big><span>اللَّهمَّ افْتَحْ لِي أَبْوَابَ رَحْمَتِكَ</span></big></p> <p style="text-align: left;"><i>Allahummaa- aftah li abwaba rahmatik</i></p> <p style="text-align: left;">(O Allah! Open for me the gates of Your mercy.) (M)</p>

<p><big><span>اللَّهمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ مِنْ فَضْلِكَ</span></big></p> <p style="text-align: left"><i>Allahumma-inee ass aluka min fadlik</i></p> <p style="text-align: left">(O Allah! I beg of You of Your Grace.) (M & AD & Ns)</p>

title: Upon Hearing The Adhan (Call to Prayer) And Iqamah
description: When you hear the Mu'adhdhin (the person who calls to prayer), repeat what he says

prayerItems.content: <p style="text-align: left">When you hear the Mu'adhdhin (the person who calls to prayer), repeat what he says. Then invoke a blessing on me, for everyone who invokes a blessing on me will receive ten blessings from Allah. Then beg from Allah al-Wasilah for me, which is a rank in Paradise fitting for only one of Allah's Servants, and I hope that I may be that one. If anyone asks that I be given the Wasilah, he will be assured of my intercession</p> <p><big>اللَّهُمَّ رَبَّ هَذِهِ الدَّعْوَةِ التَّامَّةِ، وَالصَّلَاةِ الْقَائِمَةِ، آتِ مُحَمَّداً الْوَسِيلَةَ وَالْفَضِيلَةَ، وَابْعَثْهُ مَقَاماً مَحْمُوداً الَّذِي وَعَدْتَهُ. إِنَّكَ لا تُخْلِفُ المِيْعَادِ</big></p> <p style="text-align: left"><i>Allahumma rabba hadihi-d-da wati-t-tammati was salati-l qa'imati, ati Muhammadani-l wasilata wa-l fadilata, wa-b-'athu maqamam mahmudani-l-ladi wa 'adtahu. 'Innaka La Tukhlifu Al-Mi'ad</i></p> <p style="text-align: left">(O Allah, Lord of this perfect call and established prayer. Grant Muhammad the intercession and favor, and raise him to the honored station You have promised him. You never fail in Your promise.) (M)</p>

title: Enjoining Dhikr After Prayers
description: When the Prophet (S) finished his prayer, he begged forgiveness

prayerItems.content: <p><big>أَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّهَ</big></p> <p style="text-align: left"><i>Assthegh-frrlah</i></p> <p style="text-align: left">(I seek the forgiveness of Allah)</p> <p style="text-align: left">...three times and said:</p> <p><big>اللَّهُمَّ أَنْتَ السَّلَامُ وَمِنْكَ السَّلَامُ، تَبَارَكْتَ يَا ذَا الْجَلَالِ وَالْإِكْرَامِ</big></p> <p style="text-align: left"><i>Allahuma inta salam, wa minka asalam tebarekta yathel jelal wel ekram</i></p> <p style="text-align: left">(O Allah! You are Peace, and peace comes from You. Blessed You are, O possessor of Glory and Honor). (M)</p> <p style="text-align: left">When the Prophet (S) finished the prayer and pronounced salutation, he (S) uttered (this supplication):</p> <p><big>لَا إِلهَ إِلَّا اللهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ، اللَّهُمَّ لَا مَانِعَ لِمَا أَعْطَيْتَ، وَلَا مُعْطِيَ لِمَا مَنَعْتَ، وَلَا يَنْفَعُ ذَا الْجَدِّ مِنْكَ الْجَدُّ</big></p> <p style="text-align: left"><i>La ilaha ilalah wahdawho la sherika lah, la hul mulk wa la hul hamd, wa hua ala kulee shein qedir, Alahumma la maneh li maa aah tait wa la mooh tee li maa menah-t walla yenfah thel jed minka el jed</i></p> <p style="text-align: left">(There is no god but Allah. He is alone, Who has no partner. To Him belongs the sovereignty, to Him praise is due, and He is potent over everything. O Allah! No one can withhold what You give, or give what You withhold, and the riches cannot avail a wealthy person with You.) (B & M)</p> <p style="text-align: left">Never quit saying after each prayer:</p> <p><big>اللهم اعني على ذكرك وشكرك وحسن عبادتك</big></p> <p style="text-align: left"><i>Alahumma a&apos;innee ala thikrika wa shukrika wa husnee ibadatika</i></p> <p style="text-align: left">(O Allah, help me in remembering You, in offering thanks to You, and in worshipping You properly.)</p>

<p style="text-align: left">Whoever recites three times on Friday morning before the Fajr prayer,</p> <p><big>اَسْتَغْفِرُ الله الذِي لا اِلهَ اِلاّ هُوَ الحَيّ القَيّوم وَ اَتٌوبٌ اِلَيهَ</big></p> <p style="text-align: left"><i>Asstaghfirulah allathe lailaha ila huwa, al hiyoul qaiyoum wa atubu ilay he.</i></p> <p style="text-align: left">(I ask forgiveness from Allah who is the Only God, the Living and Qayuum and repent to Him)</p> <p style="text-align: left">...Allah would forgive his sins even if they were as much as the foam of the sea. (Ibn Alsani)</p> <p style="text-align: left">Whoever prays the Fajr in Jama&apos;ah (group), then remains sitting remembering Allah (Dhikr) until the sun rises, and then prays two rakhas it is as if he performed Hajj and Umrah; complete, complete, complete. (T)</p> <p style="text-align: left">When you finish the sunset prayer (Maghrib), say:</p> <p><big>اَللْهُمّ اَجِرنِي مِنَ النّارَ</big></p> <p style="text-align: left"><i>Alahumma ajirnee minannar&apos; seven times. </i></p> <p style="text-align: left">(O Allah, protect me from Hell.)</p> <p style="text-align: left">If you say that and die that night, protection from it would be recorded for you. And when you finish the dawn prayer (Fajr), say:</p> <p><big>اَللْهُمّ اَجِرنِي مِنَ النّارَ</big></p> <p style="text-align: left"><i>Alahumma ajirnee minannar.</i> seven times.</p> <p style="text-align: left">(O Allah, protect me from Hell.)</p> <p style="text-align: left">If you die that day, you are granted protection from it. (Ad)</p>

<p style="text-align: left">Upon leaving the house the Prophet (S) recited,</p> بِسْمِ اللهِ، تَوَكَّلْتُ عَلَى اللهِ، الَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ أَنْ أَضِلَّ، أّوْ أُضَلَّ، أَوْ أَزِلَّ، أَوْ أُزَلَّ، أَوْ أَظْلِمَ، أَوْ أُظْلَمَ، أَوْ أَجْهَلَ، أَوْ يُجْهَلَ عَلَيَّ <p style="text-align: left">Bismillah tawakaltu &apos;alallah, Allahumma inni audhu bika an adilla au udalla au azilla au uzalla au azlima au-uzlama au aj-hala au yuj-hala &apos;alayya.</i></p> <p style="text-align: left">(In the name of Allah. I repose my trust in Allah, and there is neither power nor any might except with Allah. O Allah, I seek refuge with You from leading others astray, causing others to slip or being caused to slip by others, doing wrong or being wronged by others, or behaving foolishly or being treated foolishly by others). (Ah & T & Ns)</p>
